availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Crosthwait (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of William Crosthwait. Married to Jane Faulconer Crosthwait in Harrison County, Kentucky, in September 1834. Father of Louisa Crosthwait, Mary E. Crosthwait, William T. Crosthwait, and Susan A. Crosthwait. Married to Emily Hutcherson Crosthwait in Harrison County on July 11, 1842. Father of Sarah F. Crosthwait, Elizabeth J. Crosthwait, Lizaett Croswthwait, John P. Crosthwait, James M. Crosthwait, and Henry F. Crosthwait. Married to Maria Trimble Crosthwait in Harrison County on October 18, 1860. Father of Lewis E. Crosthwait and Maggie M. Crosthwait. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Richard Perkins and Alfred Perkins as laborers in Harrison County in 1850. Justice of the peace in Harrison County from 1859 to 1861. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Employed John Perkins as a farmhand in Harrison County in 1860.
